meanings.definition: Fond of sensuous luxury or pleasure.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy man lived a sybaritic life, surrounded by opulence and comfort.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the sybaritic experience of soaking in a hot tub filled with fragrant oils.
meanings.sent3: The sybaritic cat insisted on sleeping on a velvet cushion by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: Her sybaritic taste in fashion led her to only wear designer clothes.
meanings.sent5: The cruise ship offered a sybaritic journey with gourmet meals and spa treatments.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or devoted to luxury and pleasure.
meanings.sent1: The grand palace was a sybaritic display of wealth and extravagance.
meanings.sent2: The sybaritic lifestyle of the movie star included private jets and lavish parties.
meanings.sent3: The sybaritic wedding reception featured a chocolate fountain and live music.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a sybaritic paradise with blooming flowers and trickling fountains.
meanings.sent5: The hotel suite offered a sybaritic retreat with a panoramic view of the city.

meanings.sent1: The sybaritic traveler booked a first-class ticket for the luxurious journey.
meanings.sent2: She indulged in a sybaritic spa day complete with massages and facials.
meanings.sent3: The sybaritic feast included caviar, champagne, and decadent desserts.
meanings.sent4: The sybaritic vacation villa had a private pool and stunning ocean views.
meanings.sent5: The sybaritic celebration was filled with laughter, music, and fine wine.
